page.title: 02Game birds,gamekeepers.
page.content: Woodland and nearby arable land is host to pheasants,partridges ,wildfowl,rabbits,hares,woodcock,etc. Pheasants,partridges and wildfowl are incubated from eggs and reared to maturity by gamekeepers.The cost of rearing game birds to maturity is about Â£12 per bird. There are very large roosting colonies of rooks and jackdaws. Deer in the surrounding countryside consists of roe,fallow and muntjack which are managed to provide high quality stock and venison. At Northaw School,formerly{Norman {Court,}there is a building known as a{ {game larder}which is of historic interest.Birds hung there after shoot.
